first_page.use_seed_phrase_to_retrieve: Use seed phrase to retrieve existing account
first_page.if_from_relentless_marketplace: If you are, looks like you have to link your marketplace account to this dashboard account
first_page.not_from_relentless_marketplace: Nope, I'm not from Relentless Marketplace

help.plasma_chain_is_our_plasma_cash_backed: Basechain is our Basechain Cash-backed hub for transacting between sidechains and Ethereum mainnet. It allows for highly-scalable, user-facing DApps and secure asset transfers between chains.
help.when_a_user_stakes_tokens: When a user “stakes” tokens, it means they time-lock their tokens to gain rights, perform services, and access rewards on the network. As a LOOM holder, you can
help.by_staking_your_tokens_with: by staking your tokens with a validator.
help.why_is_staking_important_for: Why is staking important for Basechain?
help.as_plasma_chain_runs_a_delegated: As Basechain runs a Delegated Proof of Stake (DPoS) consensus model, staking is critical to securing the network. Through “delegation”, users support validators by proxying their tokens with those valdiators’ staking pools. The validator candidates with the largest pools become the official validators of the network. By staking your LOOM tokens, you can help choose the best validators to ensure the strongest possible security and performance for Basechain (and you can earn rewards by doing so — see below). The more people who delegate and actively contribute, the more secure the chain.
help.how_can_i_stake_my: How can I stake my LOOM tokens on Basechain?
help.you_can_stake_your_tokens: You can stake your tokens from the Basechain Dashboard:
help.log_in_to_your_meta_mask: Log in to your MetaMask wallet
help.how_many_tokens_are_required: How many tokens are required to become a delegator?
help.there_is_no_minimum_required: There is no minimum required amount of tokens to be a delegator. Any LOOM token holder can delegate to any validator candidate on the network.
help.which_validator_s_should_i_delegate: Which validator(s) should I delegate to?
help.for_a_full_list_of: for a full list of available validator candidates. Keep in mind that validators perform the critical services that maintain the integrity of the system — proposing new blocks, verifying transactions, and participating in governance. In researching the validators that best suit you, you will likely want to evaluate around criteria such as performance (uptime, slashes), reputation, fee % on rewards, community, etc.
help.do_i_lose_control_of: Do I lose control of my tokens when I delegate them to a validator?
help.no_upon_delegation_your_tokens: No. Upon delegation, your tokens will be sent to a smart contract and essentially frozen on the network for the duration of your lock-up period (which is up to you to select). When the lock-up ends, your tokens are automatically released back to you along with any additional rewards that your validator may have shared with their staking pool.
help.note_a_validator_never_has: Note: a validator never has direct control of your delegated stake. They cannot move your tokens under any circumstances. For all intents and purposes, you remain the owner while your stake is temporarily assigned to the network.
help.can_i_delegate_to_multiple: Can I delegate to multiple validator candidates?
help.yes_users_can_choose_to: Yes. Users can choose to stake their tokens across several validators simultaneously.
help.will_i_earn_rewards_on: Will I earn rewards on the tokens I delegate to a validator?
help.validators_earn_rewards_on_any: Validators earn rewards on any tokens that are delegated to their staking pool. They can choose to share a portion of those rewards back to their delegators — but this is entirely up to the validator. The percentage each validator shares will be published on the
help.to_ensure_full_transparency_so: to ensure full transparency, so that users can make informed decisions prior to staking. For additional info on rewards, see
help.this_post_on_validator_and: this post on validator and staking economics
help.what_currency_will_rewards_be: What currency will rewards be paid in?
help.how_do_i_claim_my: How do I claim my rewards?
help.the_delegation_rewards_will_be: The delegation rewards will be automatically distributed by the network, and be available under the “Rewards” tab on the
help.when_will_i_receive_rewards: When will I receive rewards on my delegations?
help.currently_validator_rewards_are_calculat: Currently, validator rewards are calculated and paid out at the end of election cycles, which run every 2 weeks.
help.note_this_is_an_area: Note: this is an area of active research and we are planning to shift toward more frequent payout cycles as the network matures.
help.how_long_will_my_stake: How long will my stake be locked for?
help.you_can_choose_from_any: You can choose from any of the pre-defined lock-up periods — 2 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, or 1 year.
help.for_the_validators_that_choose: For the validators that choose to share rewards on their staking pool, delegators will receive bonus incentives for various lock-up periods. Longer lock-ups are rewarded with higher percentages, as detailed below:
help.note_these_bonus_levels_are: Note: these bonus levels are before deduction of any validator fees.
help.how_can_i_un_delegate_my: How can I un-delegate my tokens?
help.simply_navigate_to_my_delegations: Simply navigate to “My Delegations”, select a specific validator, and click the “Un-delegate” button:
help.once_i_un_delegate_how_long: Once I un-delegate, how long will it take to regain full access to my tokens?
help.at_launch_delegators_funds_will: At launch, delegators’ funds will be fully released after 2 weeks. This is a security measure to mitigate against scenarios of staking with a bad candidate to increase their odds of gaining the right to validate, and then immediately un-delegating. This is an area of active research and something we plan to iterate through over the coming months.
help.are_there_any_ways_to: Are there any ways to lose some of my delegated tokens?
help.yes_if_the_protocol_rules: Yes. If the protocol rules are not followed, a validator can be ‘slashed’. This means they will forfeit a portion of their staked tokens, including the tokens that have been delegated to their pool. Slashing helps deter malicious behavior and maintain a system whereby everyone is playing by the same rules. It is designed to make dishonest and faulty behavior more costly than it’s worth. For instance, submitting an invalid block, attempting a double spend, and/or experiencing downtime will all lead to slashing. We will be publishing a detailed breakdown of slashing conditions as they are finalized.
help.where_do_the_tokens_go: Where do the tokens go when they are slashed?
help.slashed_tokens_will_be_contributed: Slashed tokens will be contributed back to the remaining token reserve to be paid out as future block rewards for those validating and staking on the network.
help.transfer_token: Transfer tokens to other Basechain accounts
help.check_your_asset: Check your Relentless assets (more coming soon)
help.in_order_to_deploy_contract: In order to deploy contracts to Basechain, you need to whitelist your deployment keys. You can manage your keys below, whitelist an existing key or generate a new one.
help.adding_key_requires: Adding a key requires you to stake tokens.

faq.A_What_is_Basechain:
Loom Network’s Basechain is an interoperable blockchain hub that is live in production, EVM-compatible, audited, battle-tested, and secured by [21+ validators](https://wallet.loomx.io/validators) and thousands of individual token delegators. It is optimized for scaling dapps of all shapes and sizes, and enables secure asset transfers between chains. 

Basechain already has secure bridges to the major blockchains, Ethereum, Binance Chain, and Tron — with Bitcoin, Cosmos, and more in the works.
faq.A_What_is_token_staking:
Basechain uses a Delegated Proof of Stake (DPoS) consensus mechanism, and there are a number of high-performance validator nodes that help secure the network. The users of the network help choose the validators they want to run the network. They do this by “staking” or “delegating” their LOOM tokens to validators  —  giving validators their support by proxying their tokens to them.

Any LOOM token holder can choose which Basechain validators they wish to support. Read our [Staking Guide](https://wallet.loomx.io/staking-guide) for step-by-step instructions on how to stake your LOOM.
faq.Q_Why_is_staking_important_for_Basechain: Why is staking important for Basechain?
faq.A_Why_is_staking_important_for_Basechain:
Staking is critical to securing a DPoS network. By staking your LOOM tokens, you can help choose the most reliable and high-performance validators, and thus ensure the strongest possible security and performance for Basechain. The more people who stake and actively contribute, the more decentralized and secure the chain.

You also earn rewards by staking LOOM (See: <u>How much can I be rewarded?</u>)
faq.Q_How_can_I_stake_my_LOOM_tokens_on_Base: How can I stake my LOOM tokens on Basechain?
faq.A_How_can_I_stake_my_LOOM_tokens_on_Base:
See our [Staking Guide](https://wallet.loomx.io/staking-guide) to learn how to stake your LOOM and perform other actions on the network.

All you need is a supported Ethereum wallet funded with some LOOM — both web and mobile wallets are supported. From your wallet, you can stake your tokens directly on the [Basechain Dashboard](https://wallet.loomx.io/).
faq.A_What_are_validators:
Validators are the teams that secure the network. They run the hardware that processes transactions and creates blocks on Basechain. It’s not possible to overstate the critical function that validators play in keeping the network functioning securely. Their responsibilities include:



*  Continuously running the latest version of the Loom SDK

*  Staking a minimum number of LOOM themselves (so they have skin in the game and risk being penalized for potentially being unreliable or dishonest)

*  Maintaining properly functioning hardware and 100% uptime

*  Actively participating in network governance (votes on software upgrades, changes to the fee structure, etc.)
faq.Q_What_is_the_validator_fee_for: What is the validator fee for?
faq.A_What_is_the_validator_fee_for:
Validators need to invest in hardware and perform various network services to ensure the security of Basechain, so they each charge a fee to their delegators as compensation. (Also see: <u>What are validators?</u>)

For example, if a validator had a fee of 30%, it would mean they would take 30% of the rewards listed in the table above, and you would keep the remaining 70%.

Each validator’s fee level is published on the [Validators page](https://wallet.loomx.io/validators) of the Basechain Dashboard so that users can make informed decisions prior to staking.

For additional info on fees and rewards, see [this post on validator and staking economics](https://medium.com/loom-network/plasmachain-validator-staking-economics-part-1-e816d5825849).
faq.Q_What_currency_are_rewards_paid_in: What currency are rewards paid in?
faq.A_What_currency_are_rewards_paid_in: All rewards are paid in [LOOM](https://etherscan.io/token/0xa4e8c3ec456107ea67d3075bf9e3df3a75823db0) — an ERC20 token.
faq.Q_How_do_I_claim_my_rewards: How do I claim my rewards?
faq.A_How_do_I_claim_my_rewards:
The staking rewards will be automatically distributed by the network. To claim your rewards, press the “Claim Rewards” button on the [My Account page](https://wallet.loomx.io/account).

![Basechain-Claim-Rewards.png](/assets/Basechain-Claim-Rewards.png)
faq.Q_How_much_can_I_be_rewarded: How much can I be rewarded?
faq.A_How_much_can_I_be_rewarded:
Your rewards depend on how long you stake your LOOM tokens for. You can choose from any of the pre-defined lock-up periods — 2 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, or 12 months. Longer lock-ups are rewarded with higher percentages, as detailed below:

![Staking-Rewards-Lock-up-Times](/assets/Staking-Rewards-Lock-up-Times.png)

Thus, the base reward rate is 5% per year. Higher lock-up times lead to multiplier effects: 3-month, 6-month, and 12-month lock-up periods will give you 7.5%, 10%, and 20% annual reward rates, respectively.

_Note: these bonus levels are **before** deduction of any validator fees._

**Important:** **Once tokens are locked up, they cannot be unlocked until the timer runs out. A 12-month lockup truly means your tokens are locked up for a year. This is precisely why the lock-up bonus increases with higher lock-up periods — to reward higher degrees of commitment to the network.**
faq.Q_How_many_tokens_are_required_to_become: How many tokens are required to become a delegator?
faq.A_How_many_tokens_are_required_to_become: 1 LOOM is the minimum amount that can be staked. Only whole numbers of tokens can be staked — no decimals.
faq.A_What_is_the_election_cycle: The election cycle, in simplest terms, is a repeating countdown timer. Each time the timer hits 0, any new state changes — such as delegations, redelegations, or reward payouts — are updated. The election cycle period is currently 30 minutes, and the countdown can be found on the [Validators page](https://wallet.loomx.io/validators) and the [My Account page](https://wallet.loomx.io/account).
faq.Q_Which_validator(s)_should_I_delegate_t: Which validator(s) should I delegate to?
faq.A_Which_validator(s)_should_I_delegate_t:
We encourage everyone to do their own due diligence and decide which validator(s) to stake to. This is what keeps a DPoS network secure. You can use the [Validators page](https://wallet.loomx.io/validators) of the Dashboard to see a full list of available validators. 

In researching the validators that best suit you, you will likely want to evaluate around criteria such as performance (uptime, slashes), reputation, community, fee %, additional bonuses offered, etc.

You can interact with some of the validators in the [Loom Delegators Telegram Chat](https://t.me/loomdelegators). We encourage you to talk to them personally and get an appreciation for their philosophy and approach to their validator services.

![Basechain-Validators.png](/assets/Basechain-Validators.png)
faq.Q_Do_I_lose_control_of_my_tokens_when_I_: Do I lose control of my tokens when I delegate them to a validator?
faq.A_Do_I_lose_control_of_my_tokens_when_I_:
No, you do not lose control of your tokens at any time. Upon delegation, your tokens will be sent to a smart contract and essentially frozen on the Basechain network for the duration of your lock-up period (which is up to you to select). When your chosen lock-up period ends, you are free to undelegate your tokens or delegate them again. 

_Note: A validator never has direct control of your delegated stake. They cannot move your tokens under any circumstances. For all intents and purposes, you remain the owner while your stake is temporarily assigned to the network._
faq.Q_Can_I_delegate_to_multiple_validators: Can I delegate to multiple validators?
faq.A_Can_I_delegate_to_multiple_validators: Yes, you can choose to stake your tokens across multiple validators simultaneously.
faq.Q_Can_I_delegate_multiple_times_to_the_s: Can I delegate multiple times to the same validator?
faq.A_Can_I_delegate_multiple_times_to_the_s:
Yes, you can simultaneously have multiple delegations with the same validator. You can even have each delegation under a different lock-up period, if you wish.

For example, you could have 1,000 LOOM staked in a 12-month lock-up (20% rewards) and 500 LOOM in a 6-month lock-up (10% rewards) at the same time.
faq.A_Can_I_change_validators: Yes, you can redelegate any delegation from one validator to another at any time, even while your tokens are locked. Changes will be reflected at the end of the current election cycle.
faq.Q_When_will_I_receive_rewards_on_my_dele: When will I receive rewards on my delegations?
faq.A_When_will_I_receive_rewards_on_my_dele: Validator rewards are calculated and paid out at the end of each election cycle. You can claim your rewards from the [My Account page](https://wallet.loomx.io/account).
faq.A_Are_my_rewards_automatically_redelegat:
Rewards are automatically redelegated to the validator from which you received those rewards, and will continue to earn the base reward rate (currently 5% per year). 

For a higher reward rate, you’ll need to manually claim the rewards, and then delegate them with a longer lock-up period.
faq.Q_What_happens_once_a_lock-up_period_exp: What happens once a lock-up period expires?
faq.A_What_happens_once_a_lock-up_period_exp: Once a lock-up period expires, your delegation will keep earning the base reward of 5% per year. If you would like to delegate your LOOM again for a longer lock-up period, you will have to do so manually.
faq.Q_How_can_I_undelegate_my_tokens: How can I undelegate my tokens?
faq.A_How_can_I_undelegate_my_tokens:
You must wait until your lock-up period has expired before you can undelegate your tokens. To undelegate a delegation after the lock-up period has expired, navigate to the [Validators page](https://wallet.loomx.io/validators), select the specific validator, and click the “Undelegate” button.

Once your lock-up period has expired, your delegation will remain with the validator and earn the base reward rate of 5%, until you manually delegate your LOOM again.
faq.Q_Once_I_undelegate,_how_long_will_it_ta: Once I undelegate, how long will it take to regain full access to my tokens?
faq.A_Once_I_undelegate,_how_long_will_it_ta: You will gain access to them at the end of the current election cycle. This is a security measure to mitigate against scenarios of staking with a bad candidate to increase their odds of gaining the right to validate, and then immediately un-delegating.
faq.A_What_is_the_“Redelegate”_option: The “Redelegate” option is for changing which validator you are delegating your tokens to.
faq.A_What_is_the_“Consolidate”_option:
The “Consolidate” option allows you to consolidate all unlocked delegations for one validator into a single delegation.

For example, if you ever have multiple unlocked delegations to a single validator, you can press “Consolidate” to combine them all into one delegation, so you won’t have to click each one individually to lock them up again.
faq.Q_Is_it_possible_to_lose_any_of_my_deleg: Is it possible to lose any of my delegated tokens?
faq.A_Is_it_possible_to_lose_any_of_my_deleg:
Yes, it is possible. If the protocol rules are not followed, a validator can be “slashed”. This means they will forfeit a portion of their staked tokens, including tokens that have been delegated to their pool.

Slashing deters malicious or irresponsible behavior and helps maintain a system whereby everyone is playing by the same rules. It is designed to make dishonest and faulty behavior more costly than it is worth. For instance, submitting an invalid block, attempting a double spend, and experiencing downtime will all lead to slashing. 

We will be publishing a detailed breakdown of slashing conditions as they are finalized.
faq.Q_Where_do_the_tokens_go_when_they_are_s: Where do the tokens go when they are slashed?
faq.A_Where_do_the_tokens_go_when_they_are_s: Slashed tokens will be contributed back to the remaining token reserve to be paid out as future block rewards for those validating and staking on the network.

staking_guide.intro: Congratulations on your decision to stake LOOM and help secure Basechain! This guide will walk you through the steps needed to stake your LOOM, and the various actions you can take after you’ve staked.
staking_guide.select_wallet: 1. Select a supported wallet and fund it with LOOM and ETH
staking_guide.loom_plasma_support: Loom Basechain staking currently supports the following wallets:
staking_guide.fund_wallet: Important: Make sure to fund your wallet with LOOM (ERC20) tokens and a small amount of ETH to pay for Ethereum network transaction gas fees.
staking_guide.on_desktop: On desktop, go to My Account. You should see the following page:
staking_guide.select_your_wallet: Select your wallet and follow the instructions to map your Ethereum address to a Basechain address. You will also see this pop-up the first time you use an Ethereum address on the dashboard:
staking_guide.following_page: If successful, you will see the following page (My Account), which shows your Ethereum mainnet LOOM balance, your Basechain balance, the election cycle timer, your current Rewards amount, and a list of your delegations.
staking_guide.press_deposit: Press the “Deposit” button next to the asset you wish to deposit (LOOM).
staking_guide.pop_up: A pop-up will ask you to select an amount to deposit and confirm.
staking_guide.sign_approval: You should be asked to sign the approval request transaction on the Ethereum network.
staking_guide.approval_request: When the approval request has been confirmed, you will be asked to complete the deposit by signing the deposit request.
staking_guide.yellow_warning: Note that if you got the yellow warning bar (see Step 2), you will not see the “Complete deposit” pop-up, but you’ll be asked to confirm the deposit transaction straight away.
staking_guide.block_confirmations: Wait 10 Ethereum block confirmations to see an update in your Basechain balance. You can find the number of block confirmations on the History page.
staking_guide.3_step_2: Scroll down and press “Stake Tokens” button
staking_guide.go_to_validitor: Go to the Validators page and click on the validator you would like to delegate to.
staking_guide.specific_validator: On the specific validator’s page, scroll down and press the “Stake Tokens” button.
staking_guide.pop_up_ask: A pop-up will ask you how many LOOM you wish to stake.
staking_guide.locktime_bonus: Select a locktime bonus. See this {link} for more information about locktime bonuses.
staking_guide.asked_to_sign: You will be asked to sign the transaction twice. The first time is to approve the transaction details and the second time is to actually sign the transfer of funds.
staking_guide.4_step_2: Sign the transaction for every validator
staking_guide.press_claim_button: Go to the My Account page and press the “Claim Reward” button.
staking_guide.asked_to_sign_transaction: You’ll be asked to sign the transaction.
staking_guide.if_rewards_claim: If the rewards claim is successful, then you will see this message: “X LOOM will be reclaimed after the next election.”
staking_guide.press_withdraw: Press the “Withdraw” button next to the asset you wish to withdraw (LOOM).
staking_guide.pop_up_asking: You will see a pop-up asking you how many LOOM you wish to withdraw.
staking_guide.press_next_button: Press the “Next” button. You should see the following pop-up:
staking_guide.transaction_twice: You will be asked to sign the transaction twice. If successful, you should see this pop-up:
staking_guide.confirm_withdrawal_request: You will now be asked to confirm the withdrawal request on the Ethereum network.
staking_guide.take_some_time: This may take some time, depending on how busy the Ethereum network is.
staking_guide.your_ethereum_wallet: Your LOOM will be back in your Ethereum wallet address once the Ethereum network confirms the transfer.
staking_guide.find_the_delegation: Find the delegation you wish to redelegate on the My Account page and press the “Redelegate” button.
staking_guide.validators_and_fees: You will see a pop-up that shows a list of validators and their fees:
staking_guide.select_the_validator: Select the validator you want to redelegate to and press the “Redelegate” button on the pop-up.
staking_guide.transaction_to_confirm: You will be asked to sign the transaction to confirm.
staking_guide.delegation_is_redelegating: You should now see that your delegation is “Redelegating”
staking_guide.redelegation_will_be_complete: Your redelegation will be complete at the end of the current election cycle.
staking_guide.once_the_time_lock: Once the time lock has expired on your delegation, it becomes unlocked. Unlocked delegations keep earning the base reward of 5% per year.
staking_guide.unlocked_delegation: You can undelegate an unlocked delegation if you so choose.
staking_guide.7_step_1: Find the delegation and press the “Undelegate” button
staking_guide.7_step_2: Select how much LOOM to undelegate
staking_guide.my_account_page: On the My Account page, scroll down, find the delegation, and press the “Undelegate” button.
staking_guide.how_many_loom: A pop-up will ask you how many LOOM you want to undelegate.
staking_guide.enter_amount: Enter the amount you wish to undelegate and press the “Undelegate” button.
staking_guide.undelegated_amount: Your undelegated amount will show up under Basechain balance on the My Account page once the current election cycle ends.
staking_guide.unlocked_delegations: If you have multiple unlocked delegations to a single validator, you can consolidate them into one delegation.
staking_guide.8_step_1: Go to specific validator’s page and press the “Consolidate” button
staking_guide.go_to_validator_page: Go to the validator’s page (click on a specific validator from the Validators page), scroll down, and press the “Consolidate” button.
staking_guide.once_the_transaction: Once the transaction has been signed, you’ll see the update at the end of the current election cycle.
staking_guide.any_questions: If you have any questions, please see our {link}.

add_key.whitelisting_require: Whitelisting keys requires at least {amount} LOOM. Your balance is {balance} LOOM

bounty.description: Each month, the validators who help the chain grow the most will be rewarded 2,000,000 LOOM. For this month, we’re looking for high quality staking tutorials (video highly desired) with maximum amount of engagement (in terms of likes, retweets, views, upvotes, claps, etc).
bounty.contact_desc: Loom will be evaluating submissions and choosing select winners for each bounty
bounty.contact: Contact {email} if you need guidance with submissions

statistics.no_downtime: Your validator node hasn't missed signing any blocks.

faucet_footer.loom_network_is_a_platform: Loom Network is a Platform as a Service built on top of Ethereum that allows developers to run large-scale decentralized applications. This lets developers build DApps with the trust and security of the world’s most secure public blockchain, along with the computing resources necessary to run commercial-scale services. Loom aims to be the tokenized application protocol of the new decentralized web.

approval.sent: Approval request sent successfully. You will be asked to complete the deposit once it is confirmed.
